result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle S Menger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid forthwith.  In lieu of payment, defendant to serve 9 days jail.  TIME SERVED.

Straight Time.
Apply 30 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kyle S Menger in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Nicole M Masnica.
Defendant had his revocation hearing last week and they are still waiting on a decision.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.


Court orders the following:
30  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
30 Days of Credit.
Time Served.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid - FORTHWITH - In Lieu of Payment defendant to serve 9 days in the Waukesha County Jail - Time Served.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
